Nubian pyramids are pyramids that were built by the rulers of the ancient Kushite kingdoms, The area of the Nile valley known as Nubia, was home to three Kushite kingdoms during antiquity. The first had its capital at Kerma (2600–1520 BC). The second was centered on Napata (1000–300 BC). Finally, the last kingdom was centered on Meroë (300 BC–AD 300). They are built of granite and sandstone.
